definition: Dr Sun Yat-sen's 孫中山|孙中山 Three Principles of the People (late 1890s)
surname San
three/3
surname Min
the people/nationality/citizen
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
justice/righteousness/meaning/foster (father etc)/adopted/artificial (tooth, limb etc)/relationship/friendship
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: Just show me one county where Dr. Sun's principles have been put in practice.
sentences.chinese: 你给我指出哪一个县实施了孙中山先生的三民主义？

sentences.english: The manifesto marks off the two epochs in the history of the Three People's Principles.
sentences.chinese: 这篇宣言，区分了三民主义的两个历史时代。

sentences.english: What are the Three Principles of The People?
Is it realistic of Chiang Ching kuo to propose unifying China with the "Three People's Principles"?
sentences.chinese: 蒋经国提出用“三民主义”统一中国，这现实吗？

sentences.english: The Kuomintang could not have gone forward unless it had developed them into the new Three People's Principles.
sentences.chinese: 如不把它发展到新三民主义，国民党就不能前进。

sentences.english: They are, by the simplest definition, the principles for our nation's salvation.
sentences.chinese: 用最简单的定义说，三民主义就是救国主义。

sentences.english: The noumenon of the "Three Principles of the People " was an important topic that the monthly magazine New Life discussed.
sentences.chinese: 三民主义本体是《新生命》月刊检讨的重要议题。

sentences.english: Debate of Sanmin Doctrine was a unique political-cultural phenomenon in the period of Anti-Japanese War.
sentences.chinese: 三民主义论战是抗战时期的独特政治文化现象。

definition: principle of people's livelihood, the third of Dr Sun Yat-sen's 孫中山|孙中山 Three Principles of the People 三民主義|三民主义 (at the time, meaning redistribution of wealth, self-sufficiency and internal trade)

democracy/civil liberties/principle of democracy, the second of Dr Sun Yat-sen's 孫中山|孙中山 Three Principles of the People 三民主義|三民主义 (at the time, meaning widespread popular involvement in affairs of state)

Sun Yat-sen's Five-power constitution of Republic of China, then of Taiwan/The five courts or 院[yuan4] are 行政院[xing2 zheng4 yuan4] Executive yuan, 立法院[li4 fa3 yuan4] Legislative yuan, 司法院[si1 fa3 yuan4] Judicial yuan, 考試院|考试院[kao3 shi4 yuan4] Examination yuan, 監察院|监察院[jian1 cha2 yuan4] Control yuan
expel the Manchu, revolutionary slogan from around 1900
constitutional government
democratic revolution/bourgeois revolution (in Marx-Leninist theory, a prelude to the proletarian revolution)
Dr Sun Yat-sen (1866-1925), first president of the Republic of China and co-founder of the Guomintang 國民黨|国民党/same as 孫逸仙|孙逸仙
republican system of government
autocratic monarchy/imperial regime
(political) party platform/party program
Xinhai Revolution (1911), which ended the Qing Dynasty
New Democracy
Marxism-Leninism
father or founder of a nation/Father of the Republic (Sun Yat-sen)
Leninism
alliance with Russia (e.g. of early Chinese communists)
